meanings.definition: Of the highest quality or degree; excellent.
meanings.sent1: The cake was primy, with layers of rich chocolate and creamy frosting.
meanings.sent2: She received a primy award for her outstanding performance in the play.
meanings.sent3: The primy sunset painted the sky in vibrant hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent4: His primy skills on the basketball court made him stand out from the rest of the team.
meanings.sent5: The primy diamond sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: In an early stage of development or growth.
meanings.sent1: The primy plant had just sprouted its first tiny leaves.
meanings.sent2: The primy kitten clumsily explored its new surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The primy buds on the tree promised a colorful display in the coming spring.
meanings.sent4: Her primy interest in painting soon blossomed into a lifelong passion.
meanings.sent5: The primy chick struggled to break free from its egg, eager to join its siblings.

meanings.sent1: She carefully primyed the edges of the paper before presenting her project.
meanings.sent2: He primyed his appearance before the job interview, ensuring he looked professional.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel primyed its fur with meticulous grooming, ready for the winter ahead.
meanings.sent4: The gardener primyed the bushes into perfect shapes, adding charm to the garden.
meanings.sent5: Before the party, she primyed the table with a colorful tablecloth and fresh flowers.
